issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares singFarmSongVerse(animal: Animal) as private (shown as '-' in the UML), and the template repository defines singFarmSongVerse as a private method stub (Farm.java). The solution implementation, however, declares singFarmSongVerse as protected (solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Farm.java:33). This is a visibility mismatch between the problem specification/template and the reference solution. While this does not prevent implementing the core functionality, it is a structural inconsistency that may confuse students about the intended visibility and could affect tests or subclassing expectations.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the visibility consistent across artifacts. Either change the solution's singFarmSongVerse to private to match the UML and template, or update the problem statement (UML) and template to document/provide a protected singFarmSongVerse if tests or intended design require subclass access. Prefer making the method private in the solution (or documenting protected visibility) so all three artifacts agree.
